title: Deployed Systems Summer Intern
content:
The Electronic Systems team at Two Six Technologies is seeking Research Interns for the Summer of 2024! The Electronic Systems team has focus areas in Forward and reverse engineering, FPGA development, Vulnerability & Malware Research, Applied Mathematics, Formal Methods, and Cryptographic Protocols.  This position will require the independent ability to be onsite at the Two Six Headquarters in Arlington, Virginia daily.
Here is a quick summary of expectations:
Responsibilities:

Participate in cutting-edge research, and be encouraged to publish results
Build deployable and scalable systems that solve real-world problems
Work closely with a dedicated mentor who will encourage and support your professional growth
Present an end-of-internship project 

Minimum Qualifications:

Pursuing a degree in CS, EE, Math, Statistics or a related field
Familiar with at least one  programming language - our teams use 

Python, JavaScript
Embedded Development: C/C++
Operating Systems Research: C/C++, C#, Java
Digital Design: Verilog, System Verilog

Strong communication skills and a willingness to build team culture and capabilities

 Must have at least ONE of the following:

Experience in digital logic design for FPGAs using Verilog, SystemVerilog, or VHDL
Mobile and embedded system development or architecture (Android, ARM, wireless, etc.)
Program analysis, reverse engineering, vulnerability research, cryptographic protocols
Fundamental understanding of networking protocols, operating systems, or kernels
Computer or network exploitation skills (memory corruption, rootkits, MetaSploit, nmap, etc.)

Nice to Have:

Prior experience in an R&D internship, research group, or STEM-related extracurricular 
Publications or patents from prior intellectual pursuits
Active Secret Clearance

Clearance/Citizenship:

US Citizenship is required.
Ability to obtain a secret clearance

This is a 10 Week Program. This internship is 100% on-site located at HQ in Arlington, VA.

Additionally, please be advised that this business uses E-Verify in its hiring practices.
